content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator 9 plus, 2 x times e raised to the negative x over 4 power, and denominator the cosine of, open parenthesis, x over 2, close parenthesis, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>9</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. The Intermediate Value Theorem applied to <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 24 comma 28, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>24</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>28</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> guarantees a solution in <math alttext="open bracket, 24 comma 28, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>24</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>28</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> to which of the following equations?

topic.text: 1.16: Working with the Intermediate Value Theorem (IVT)

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
